column4: Doesn anyone know what's a good program for Windows to remote connect to Ubuntu?
ssh or vnc
is it usb or pci?
run lspci and it will tell you what chip it has, you can websearch from there
id get connectivity before worrying about apps
which is what im tryin to do.
well you need the basics first
lspci will tell you what you have and you can websearch it in windows
ubuntu dont make the parts so thats not possible
ubuntu is a concactonation of muliple projects
does wired work?
get the exact error if you can, to blacklist a module it needs adding to the blacklist file (if thats what is needed)
I'm trying to figure out if it's a buggy driver before I go and install it heh
it works fine
check your CPU spec, also make sure the feature isenabled
why do you need 64bit guest?
i see
if the cpu doesn't support 64bit guest you will need to buy 32bit XP etc
if you run:  lsusb  you will get a hex ID, what is it?
Bus 001 Device 002: ID 13b1:002f Linksys AE1000 v1 802.11n [Ralink RT2870]
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1621022   seems comprehensive
